comments:
I am getting a NullPointerException in the new EMF model wizard when attempting
to create a genmodel from an ecore model file.  I have encountered this after
making adjustments to my ecore model file with the "Sample Ecore Model Editor".
 I suspect that something has become invalid in my model file that is causing
this problem, however, I can not determine what it is.

I am using Eclipse 3.0 RC1 with the latest EMF integration build (I200406030436)
and Sun JDK 1.4.2_04.

What have you tried to do to determine the problem? Eclipse has a very nice 
debugger and even looking at the source line for the stack trace will reveal 
much. I.e., since it's croaking at this line:

  return isFeatureMapEntry(getEcoreFeature().getEType().getInstanceClassName());

No doubt you have a feature without a type.  It's of course possible that 
getEcoreFeature() is null, but since this is being called from initialize which 
has just set the feature, that doesn't seem possible in this case.

Plan item 51 

http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/scripts/docs.php?doc=docs/dev-plans/emf-sd
o-dev-plan-2004.html

is to provide diagnostics for invalid Ecore models, which would detect a feature 
without a type, but we won't be able to do that for EMF 2.0.
